intro: Spergularia tangerina, commonly known as the Mediterranean sandspurry, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and small, pink or white flowers. The plant typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed habitats. Its leaves are narrow and fleshy, adapted to conserve water in arid conditions. Spergularia tangerina is also known for its ability to form dense mats, which can help stabilize soil and prevent erosion.
